metadata.title: An automated Residual Exemplar Local Binary Pattern and iterative ReliefF based corona detection method using lung X-ray image

body_text.text: Covid-19 is a world threating virus and more than 300,000 people suffer from Covid-19. This disease is rapidly transmitted worldwide. To automatically detect this disease, we propose a novel machine learning method. In infectious diseases, machine learning methods should be used in critical tasks. Therefore, our main motivation is to detect Covid-19 by using a computer vision method (without human).

Studies on Covid-19 disease that appeared in December 2019 are limited. Many of these limited studies are for the recognition of the Covid-19 virus [13,14]. Also, some studies have been conducted on the effects of this disease on humans [[15], [16], [17], [18], [19]]. At the same time, the treatment of the Coronavirus and the processes occurring after it have been examined by Zhang et al. In the study, the possible conditions of the patient who was treated on Covid-19 disease and discharged were examined [2]. Covid-19 was examined in terms of dermatologists by Darlenski and Tsankov. They presented the effects of extreme hygiene measures on the skin and the factors that dermatologists will consider in this regard [20]. Chen et al. focused on the prevent that can be taken for the Covid-19 virus and the success of a new type of treatment. The effect of mesenchymal stem cell therapy on the Covid-19 virus was interpreted with this study, and it was emphasized that it would be an alternative for treatment [21]. Holland et al. presented the kit developed by emergency doctors to protect against the Covid-19 virus [22]. On the other hand, Yang et al. examined the possible effects of the Covid-19 virus on children and their future [23]. The study emphasized the importance of protection prevent in children with other chronic conditions, and it was also emphasized that newborns should be isolated. Lai et al. presented symptoms of coronavirus and pneumonia in their studies. In this study, it was found that it was mostly infected in adult patients. Ways to protect against this virus are presented [9]. Li et al. investigated the genetic evolution and source of the Covid-19 virus [24]. These studies are currently limited in the literature and are expected to increase rapidly since the Covid-19 virus has just been introduced and the available data are not sufficient. However, symptoms of Covid-19 disease are similar to those of pneumonia, and a certain percentage of deaths due to the Covid-19 virus are on Pneumonia disease. There are many studies on the classification of Pneumonia disease with intelligent systems in the literature. Togacar et al. [25] have presented an intelligent classification system for Pneumonia disease. Chest radiographs were used for this study. In this study, deep learning methods were used and the results were presented by using AlexNet, VGG-16, and VGG-19 neural network models. The accuracy values for the selected dataset have resulted in 99.41%. Sousa et al. [26] provided automatic pneumonia diagnosis in infants through computer-aided systems from radiographic images. In this system, pneumonia data is classified using three classifiers. The classifiers used are Support Vector Machines, K-Nearest Neighbor and Naïve Bayes. In this study, it was determined that the most suitable classifier for the available data is Support Vector Machines. Pneumonia disease was identified and classified by chest x-ray images by Jaiswal et al. [27]. In this study, deep convolutional neural network method was used. The main purpose of using this method is to provide an effective acquisition of local and global features of chest X-ray images. In this study, NIH CXR14 [28] dataset was used. In the study, the evaluation parameter mean threshold value and mean score was selected. Liang and Zheng [29] have developed a smart system for child Pneumonia disease. The convolutional neural network method was used in the developed system and the performance of Kermany [30] dataset was used. In this study, accuracy, precision, recall, f1-score, and AUC were used as evaluation criteria. The accuracy value was calculated as 90.5% in the proposed method. Sirazitdinov et al. interpreted chest x-ray images with machine learning techniques. RSNA Pneumonia Detection Challenge dataset [31] was used in the study. In the study, precision, recall, F1-score were used to evaluate the results.

To detect Covid-19 flu, a novel method is presented. This method consists of preprocessing, feature extraction with ResExLBP, feature selection with IRF and classification phases. In the preprocessing phase, the input X-ray image is transformed into grayscale image and is resized 512 ​× ​512 sized image. ResExLBP divides input image into 128 ​× ​128 sized exemplars and LBP extracts feature from the input image and exemplars of it. The generated features are concatenated and discriminative ones of them are selected by using IRF. The selected features by IRF are utilized as input of the classifiers by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV.

The contributions of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based Corona detection method are given in below.•LBP is one of the widely used feature extractors in the literature and is effective method. It generates low-level features. Therefore, LBP cannot effectively solve some problems, for instance, facial expression recognition. Therefore, exemplar LBP was presented to extracted middle and low-level features. In this work, we proposed ResExLBP feature extraction method. It uses both LBP and exemplar LBP together to extract low, middle and high-level features.•ReliefF is one of the most preferred distance based feature selector. It is a parametric feature selector. To automated feature selection, we presented a novel iterative ReliefF based feature selector (IRF).•To obtain general performance, LOOCV and 10-fold CV are used in this work. Five classifiers were also selected to show the general success of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method.•The proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method reached perfect classification rate (100.0%) for Corona detection by using X-ray images.

LBP was presented in 1994 by Ojala. It is a very effective and simple feature extractor [32, 33]. The main aim of the LBP is to extract local features for achieving global optimum features. Therefore, LBP divide image into 3 ​× ​3 sized overlapping blocks to extract neighborhood relations. The steps of the LBP are given below [34].
Step 0: Load input image with the size of WxH. Wand Hare the width and height of the image.
Step 1: Divide the input image into 3 ​× ​3 sized overlapping block and obtain (W−2)x(H−2)blocks.
Step 2: Extract binary features from each block by using signum function. The description of the signum function is mathematically shown below.
(1)bit(k)=signum(np,cp)={0,np<cp1,np≥cp,k={1,2,…,8}where npis a neighbor pixel, cp defines center pixel of the 3 ​× ​3 sized block. In the 3 ​× ​3 sized block, there are 8 neighbor pixels and a center pixel. Therefore, 8 bits are extracted from a pixel.
Step 3: Convert bits to a decimal value.
(2)value(m,t)=∑k=18bit(k)∗28−k,m={1,2,…,W−2},t={1,2,…,H−2}

Step 4: Construct a LBP implemented image by using values.
Step 5: Extract histogram of the LBP implemented image. The extracted histogram is utilized as feature. LBP extract 256 features because LBP implemented image is coded with 8-bit. A graphical explanation of the LBP is shown in Fig. 1
[35,36].
LBP is utilized as basic feature in our feature generation model and we used LBP procedure for feature extraction. The pseudocode of the is also shown in Algorithm 1 [37,38].

The preprocessing phase is one of the most important phases of the proposed method because success of this phase is directly affected the classification capability. Here, we used basic and effective methods. The steps of this method are given below.Step 0: Load raw X-ray image.Step 1: Apply raw X-ray image to grayscale conversion.Step 2: Resize gray scale image to 512 ​× ​512 size image.Step 3: Divide the image into 64 ​× ​64 sized exemplars and obtain 16 exemplars.
body_text.section: Preprocessing ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text: We proposed a novel feature extraction model in this phase and this model is called as ResExLBP. As we know from the literature, LBP is one of the effective feature extractions. The advantages of the LBP are given as follows. LBP extracts discriminative features, has low computational complexity and application of it is easy because it has a basic algorithm. Because of these advantages, we selected LBP as feature extractor. The main problem of the LBP is to extract low-level features. Therefore, we proposed a residual and exemplar model to extract low, medium and high-level features. The procedure of the ResExLBP is shown in Algorithm 2.
body_text.section: Residual exemplars local binary pattern based feature extraction: ResExLBP ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text: In the ResExLBP, LBP is applied preprocessed image and 256 features are extracted from this image. Then, LBP is applied to exemplars of this image. In this work, 64 ​× ​64 sized exemplars are used and 256 features each exemplar are generated. These features are concatenated and 4352 features are obtained. In the feature selection phase, most discriminative of the extracted 4352 features are selected.
body_text.section: Residual exemplars local binary pattern based feature extraction: ResExLBP ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text:
As we know from the literature, many feature reduction methods have been used to increase classification capability. ReliefF [39,40] is one of the distance based feature selectors in the literature. ReliefF uses Manhattan distance to calculate weights and generates both negative and positive weights. The negative weights assign redundant features in the ReliefF. ReliefF is improved version of the Relief. In the Relief based feature selection method, Euclidean distance is used but ReliefF uses Manhattan distance to generate weights. Mathematical notation of the ReliefF based weight generation is shown in Eqs. (3), (4), (5)).(3)WR(fti)=WR(fti)−∑j=1kdist(A,T,N)n∗k+∑C≠class(R)[Pr(C)1−Pr(R)∗∑l=1kdist(A,T,M)]n∗k
(4)distance(A,L1,L2)={0,L1=L21,L1≠L2
(5)distance(A,L1,L2)=|L1−L2|Amax−Aminwhere WR(fti) is weights of ith feature, k is missing number of classes, T is selected data in cycle, dist defines distance, N represents nearest class, n is number of cycles and Pr is probability.
body_text.section: Feature selection with iterative ReliefF ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text:
One of the main problems of the ReliefF is to automatically select most discriminative features. Therefore, an iterative ReliefF method is proposed in this work. To automatically select optimal features, we need a loss calculator. We aimed to classify images in this work. Therefore, we used a classification method as loss value calculator and LD is chosen as loss calculator. Steps of the IRF are given below.Step 1: Calculate ReliefF weights of the features.
(6)wR=ReliefF(f,target,10)where wR is ReliefF weights and ReliefF(.,.,.) is weight calculation function of the ReliefF.Step 2: Sort wR by descending to find indices of the sorted weights.
(7)[wsortedRendex]=sort(wR,descending)where wsortedR sorted weights and endex is index of the positive weighted features.Step 3: Calculate loss values of the features iteratively by using Algorithm 3.

Step 4: Find minimum error.
(8)[minimumindice]=min(loss)where min(.) is minimum function.Step 5: Select optimum features by using indice and endex values.
(9)feature(i)=f(endex(i)),i={1,2,…,indice}
body_text.section: Feature selection with iterative ReliefF ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text: Steps 1–5 openly show automatic feature selection process using ReliefF and LD. Classifier is optional in this method. We selected LD for this work. The users/researchers can be select another classifier to calculate loss values. The selected features by IRF are utilized as input of classifiers. In this work, IRF selected 1459 features from the extracted 4352 features.
body_text.section: Feature selection with iterative ReliefF ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text:
To show effectiveness of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method, we used 5 classifiers. These classifiers are DT [41,42], LD [43], kNN [44], SVM [45] and SD [46]. To show general success of the proposed method, we tested the optimal features by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV. In the LOOCV, there is no random assignment. Therefore, it gives one accuracy value. 10-fold CV uses random selection, hence, we executed it 1000 times to evaluate general results. MATLAB Classification Learner (MCL) was used to execute these classifiers. We used default settings for these classifiers. Parameters of the used classifiers are shown in Table 1
.
body_text.section: Classification ::: The proposed X-ray image based automated corona detection method

body_text.text:
Covid-19 causes lung viral infection and the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method aimed to detect this viral infection. Therefore, we collected a dataset from Kaggle and Github. There are 321 lung X-ray images in this dataset. 87 of these X-ray images have belonged to Covid-19 and 234 of them have belonged to healthy subjects. In this section, we tested our proposed method on this dataset. This dataset is heterogeneous because there are 87 coronas and 234 healthy subjects. If a classifier predicts all of them healthy, it achieved 234/321 ​= ​72.89% classification accuracy. Therefore, sensitivity, specificity, balanced accuracy, geometric mean and accuracy evaluation criteria are used and the mathematical explanation of them is shown in Eqs. (10), (11), (12), (13), (14)) [47].(10)CAC=TP+TNTP+TN+FP+FN
(11)SEN=TPTP+FN
(12)SPE=TNFP+TN
(13)BCAC=((TPTP+FN)+(TNFP+TN))2
(14)GM=(TPTP+FN)x(TNFP+TN)where TP, TN, FP, and FN are true positive, true negative, false positive and false negative respectively. CAC is classification accuracy, SEN represents sensitivity, SPE describes specificity, BCAC is balanced classification accuracy and GM denotes geometric mean.

LOOCV and 10-fold CV are used for testing and training. We selected them to obtain robust results. The obtained LOOCV results are listed in Table 2
.

As seen from Table 3, SVM achieved 100.0% classification accuracy and general success rate of the SVM was calculated as 99.55% ​± ​0.17%. Table 2, Table 3 clearly shown that the best classifier is SVM and the worst resulted classifier is DT. SD and LD achieved same success rates by using LOOCV but LD reached higher success rate than SD by using 10-fold CV. The scatter plot of the extracted features is shown in Fig. 3
.

Fig. 3 shown success of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF clearly. Advantages of the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method are;•ResExLBP increased feature extraction capability of the LBP. Because LBP extracts low-level feature but our proposed ResExLBP extracts low, medium and high-level features.•Automatic feature selection problem of the ReliefF is solved by proposing IRF.•We presented a novel automated Covid-19 detection method with high accuracy.

In this paper, we proposed two novel methods to accurately detect corona patients by using lung X-ray images. The proposed methods are ResExLBP feature extraction and IRF feature selection methods. The main objective of the ResExLBP is to extract meaningful features and IRF is proposed to select most discriminative features. The selected most discriminative features were classified by using 5 methods with LOOCV and 10-fold CV. The proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method achieved 99.69% and 100.0% classification accuracy by using SVM with LOOCV and 10-fold CV respectively. Robust classification results rates were calculated by using LOOCV and 10-fold CV. We also showed number of errors in Table 1.

Interesting future directions are given below.•Corona is a deadly virus and it has been seen worldwide. Smart health systems should be used to detect Covid-19 quickly. A novel smart heath assistant can be developed by using the proposed ResExLBP and IRF together.•Quarantine is one of the applied effective methods to prevent the spread of the coronavirus (Covid-19). It is very important to establish unmanned health units to track patients in quarantine and protect health workers. In these units, intelligent systems can be used to track patients and these systems can be developed by using machine learning method as the proposed ResExLBP and IRF based method.•To solve other biomedical image problems, the proposed model can be used as a solution method.•The residual exemplar is a basic model. In this work, we used LBP in this model. Researchers can be used other feature extractors in the residual exemplar model and they can propose novel ResEx based methods.

Turker Tuncer: Conceptualization, Investigation, Methodology, Project administration, Resources, Software, Supervision, Writing - review & editing. Sengul Dogan: Formal analysis, Validation, Visualization, Writing - original draft, Writing - review & editing. Fatih Ozyurt: Data curation, Funding acquisition, Writing - review & editing.

There is no ‘Conflict of Interest’ in the publication of the manuscript “An Automated Residual Exemplar Local Binary Pattern and Iterative ReliefF based Corona Detection Method using Lung X-ray Image”.
